sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An account of the days of the going out of all the carriers, waggoners, and stage-coaches, that come to London, Westminster and Southwark, from all parts of England and Wales also of fairs and roads.
20 p.
Sold by G. Conyers, at the Ring in Little-Brittain, [London] : [between 1690 and 1700]
Caption title. Publication information from colophon; dates of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.) and NUC pre-1956 imprints. Signatures: a⁶, b⁴. "Price 2 d." Imperfect: stained. Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
=======

Sold by G. Conyers, at the Ring in Little-Brittain, [London] : [between 1690 and 1700]
